pull.title: build: drop obj/ subdirectory for generated build.h
pull.body: As indicated by the TODO, the obj subdirectory is not needed anymore now for the generated build.h header, since autotools are gone and we don't have in-source builds anymore (see #30454, #30664). In the second commit the superflous `HAVE_BUILD_INFO` macro is dropped, as suggested in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30856#pullrequestreview-2292424496.

nit
it might be useful for reviewers to know what PR/PR's the `After the transition from Autotools to CMake` refers to, if you can add to the description

I'm assuming it is these ones
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30454
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30664

> nit it might be useful for reviewers to know what PR/PR's the `After the transition from Autotools to CMake` refers to, if you can add to the description

Good idea.

> I'm assuming it is these ones #30454 #30664

Yes it's these two, linked them in the PR description.

ACK 820bae4708b013a1634bc62e0c6b56c9688ac645.

I wonder if we can get rid of the `HAVE_BUILD_INFO` macro simultaneously or in a follow-up.

> I wonder if we can get rid of the `HAVE_BUILD_INFO` macro simultaneously or in a follow-up.

Sounds reasonable and simple enough (if I didn't miss anything), added a commit for that in this PR.
Could you rebase this, now that guix builds are reproducible again.

events.message: build: drop obj/ subdirectory for generated build.h

build: drop superfluous `HAVE_BUILD_INFO` define

build.h should always be generated before clientversion.cpp is compiled
due to the following explicit dependency in src/CMakeLists.txt:

add_dependencies(bitcoin_clientversion generate_build_info)

Hence there is no need to gate the inclusion of that header with an
extra define.

events.body:
> Could you rebase this, now that guix builds are reproducible again.

Sure, done.
